publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1070# Lord James Douglas-Hamilton: Proposed Closure of Five Primary Schools in Midlothian-That the Parliament believes that the proposed closure of five primary schools in a countryside setting in Midlothian is unjustifiable on educational and social grounds and that these schools are centres of educational excellence and of great importance to the local communities. Supported by: David McLetchie*, Bill Aitken*, John Scott*

S2M-1070# Lord James Douglas-Hamilton: Proposed Closure of Five Primary Schools in Midlothian-That the Parliament believes that the proposed closure of five primary schools in a countryside setting in Midlothian is unjustifiable on educational and social grounds and that these schools are centres of educational excellence and of great importance to the local communities. Supported by: David McLetchie, Bill Aitken, John Scott, Margo MacDonald*
S2M-1070# Proposed Closure of Five Primary Schools in Midlothian (lodged on 18 March 2004) Tommy Sheridan*, Colin Fox*
S2M-1070# Proposed Closure of Five Primary Schools in Midlothian (lodged on 18 March 2004) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Christine Grahame*, John Swinburne*
S2M-1070# Proposed Closure of Five Primary Schools in Midlothian (lodged on 18 March 2004) Fiona Hyslop*
